Reviews.Title: Didn't work with original firmware.  Please learn from my headache.
Reviews.Author: JB
Reviews.Content: First off, this isn't the first time I have used this model, but it is the first time with the firmware 5.PKT1.  This module ships with the 5.PKT1 firmware, which you are not told when buying it.  To Amazon, I give 2 stars.  At least got the model correct, and stated it was for a Toyota.  Anyway.  I install this in my 2010 Tundra, first with T-taps, then when that didn't work, I soldered the connections following directly the install manual, and still didn't work, and yes, I tried both primary keys.  The LED would flash like it was receiving the key code, but would flash for 30 seconds and return to a solid light.  I started to think I had a defective unit, but luckily I had a shop near me that was willing to help, and they re-flashed the original firmware with the same, and it still didn't work.  So after several attempts, I had them change the firmware to PKT2, and all works perfect. Though it does require a completely different way of wiring it up.  If you ask me, the transponder in Toyota's (Tundra at least) are to weak to work with the original firmware.  So if you order this, beware, that you might have to play around with it as I did, and hopefully you have a local shop with a XKLoader to help you, or own one of your own.  Honestly, you can get this module, and the XKLoader2 for less then just the module at "Worst Buy".

Reviews.Title: Works great, and best price at Amazon
Reviews.Author: Shawn "Shawn in Raleigh, NC"
Reviews.Content: Comes with the PKT1 interface software, which is what I needed for my 2008 Toyota 4Runner. Simple hookup...just 5 wires (power, ground, data receive, data transmit, and trigger). I installed it myself. This unit is small -- about the size of a matchbox. It has clear instructions.The programming step took me 3 tries to get the timing right, but I think that was my fault. Works great! And the price at Amazon is half what other sites are selling it for.Overall a much better solution to key-transponder engine immobilizer bypass than some of the products that require you to seal one of your master keys in a box under the dash, or install a transmitter near, or another ring around, your ignition switch. This unit just intercepts the digital keycode the first time you use it (during the programming step) over the car's own data wires, stores it, and then transmits the code at the correct time (when your remote starter is triggered) over the car's own data wires thereafter.

Reviews.Title: Description is incorrect.
Reviews.Author: Brian Bayliss
Reviews.Content: This does not work with all late model Toyota's as advertised.  I tried it on my 2010 Rav 4, with a "G" stamped key, and it failed.  Upon further investigation, the manual and website for the item informs that it only works for 2009 and older Toyota's.

Reviews.Title: Data Transponder Override Interface
Reviews.Author: Eric Neverson
Reviews.Content: needed this to go with my viper 5901 alarm system for my 07 camry.  had it installed at best buy and have no problems right now (been almost a month).

Reviews.Title: Must program first
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: Make sure you get the XKLOADER2 as well so you can program the module, out of the box it won't work otherwise. Once I did that, everything was gravy.

Reviews.Title: Bad unit. programs fine with the loader, but will not learn key. 2003 4Runner
Reviews.Author: William Kyle Thomason
Reviews.Content: Ended up taking car to installer . $180 later , this part was bad out of the box. Do not use this item for Code Alarm installs.  Use flash logic instead.

Reviews.Title: Good buy!
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: Worked well and a good buy for the money. You just need an x-loader to program the module. The unit shipped quickly also.

Reviews.Title: Excellent... but needs to be programmed.
Reviews.Author: tpthatsme
Reviews.Content: This worked perfectly once it was programmed with my make and model car. I had to pay Best Buy $20 to do it and I felt ripped off because I knew exactly what to do with a little reading online, but you need a special tool to program it. The tool cost was more than $20, so I paid the geeks. After that my Viper autostart works great!

Reviews.Title: Works great!
Reviews.Author: C. Mockensturm
Reviews.Content: Installed in a 2004 Toyota sienna. Direct wiring instead of wire wrap is defiantly the best solution. I have never had a problem with this module. Installation is a breeze and programming is a snap on Toyota vehicles (just turn on the car and its programmed). Works just as well using W2W or Data bus.

ProductInfo.Features:
For All Late Model Toyota & Lexus Vehicles
Including Smart-Key Push-to-Start Ignition Systems
Vehicle Interface Kit Module and 10-Pin Harness
Data Immobilizer Override Interface is Preloaded with Firmware
Preloaded data interface for remote start in select Toyota/Lexus vehicles
Wire to wire compatible with any type of remote car starter (W2W)
Secure single-wire data transfer prevents analogue override activation
ProductInfo.Name: Directed Electronics Inc XK05 XpressKit Remote Start Interface
